messages: d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (10:44): why must i be stuck with mssql2000
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:46): it's a 6-years old db that should be put in museum
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (10:46): my host doesn't support mssql2005
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:47): M$ should have mad mssql2003 or 2002
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:48): Promit: mssql lacks paging support, and thus screw up most web apps
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (10:48): i think ill just go with mysql
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:48): and has no snapshot, which every other DBs have
e264c3428ff7bc1961b577b41edeef50 (10:48): could you elaborate on "paging support" ?
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:48): Promit: limit on SELECT results
e264c3428ff7bc1961b577b41edeef50 (10:48): so you can't put LIMIT 20 or something in your selects?
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:48): Promit: generic limit i mean, doesn't depend on the keys
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:49): Promit: you can use TOP, not can't skip rows
e264c3428ff7bc1961b577b41edeef50 (10:49): i assume 2005 fixes these things?
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:49): Promit: so they usually have to compare primary key or other things, but that's damned hard to write
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:50): but M$ could have release some patch many years ago
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:50): it's damn simple feature that doesn't require more than a few lines of code
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (10:53): So what do I do use a crappy mssql200 or go for mysql?
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:55): but older versions suck ass
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:55): well if you dont need encoding convert, it might be okay
a5e873b0df0da2a1a057b4b272f88ba6 (10:56): but i'm not sure about its support for subquery and others
e264c3428ff7bc1961b577b41edeef50 (10:56): sounds like you're getting pretty shafted here
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (10:58): 50gb of space and 500gb of b/w is awesome for 6.99
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (11:00): my mssql2005 book is totally boring
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (11:00): it takes like 200 pages just get to do something with mssql2005
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (11:08): too tired to talk to me
fae3e475729f65b9660b020089f7ea3e (11:09): i gottago to work... ttyl....
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (11:10): she never has the time for me >.<
d5e96bd572d12bda9dd5ff8b45ede70f (11:12): anyone know a mssql2005 host with decent shit
